The Lost Road and Other Writings

wikitext.*:
'''Gilim''' was a [[giants|giant]] of [[Araman|Eruman]],<ref>{{LT2|In}}, pp. 67-8</ref> apparently noteworthy for his neck. [[Lúthien]] named him in her growth-spell.<ref>{{HM|LR}}, "[[The Lay of Leithian]]", [[Lay of Leithian Canto V|Canto V]], verse 1497</ref>

In [[Gnomish]], one of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s early conceptions of an [[Elvish|Elven]] tongue, ''Gilim'' is given the translaton "winter".<ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 38 (see also p. 35, entry for ''folornin'', and p. 8)</ref>
